Name: hexamethylenediamine production | hexamethylenediamine | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of hexamethylenediamine through hydrogenation of adiponitrile. Hexamethylenediamine is a colorless to yellow solid with a strong amine odor. Hexamethylenediamine is mainly used for producing polymers. A yield of 95% was assumed.;C6H8N2 + 4 H2 --> C6H16N2;References:;Smiley, R. A. (2009), Hexamethylenediamine, Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Weinheim, Wiley-VCH.;Curtius, T.;  Clemm, H. (1900): Synthese des 1,3-Diaminopropans und 1,6-Diaminohexans aus Glutarsäure resp. Korksäure (Synthesis of 1,3-diaminopropane and 1,6-diaminohexane from glutaric acid and suberic acid, respectively), Journal für praktische Chemie, 2nd series, 62, 189–211.
